## Erosion Protection Project on the Alaska Highway
### Tender Notice

The Government of Canada has issued a tender notice for an erosion protection project on the Alaska Highway in northern British Columbia. The project is located at Km 660 on the Alaska Highway, approximately 13 km west of the community of Toad River.

### Project Overview

The project involves the construction of a 220 m long riprap revetment along the right downstream bank of the Toad River to protect the Alaska Highway from erosion during high flow events. The works will be carried out in a remote area and require specialized equipment and expertise.

### Mandatory Requirements

Bidders are required to submit an Indigenous Participation Plan (IPP) as part of the procurement process. This plan must demonstrate opportunities for Indigenous Peoples to participate in the project through the provision of goods, services, training, employment, apprenticeship, or sub-contracting opportunities. The plan must provide specific details on participation opportunities for the Indigenous Peoples and firms owned by Indigenous Peoples.

### Tender Details

* Tender Reference Number: WS4234577987
* Solicitation Number: WS4234577987
* Publication Date: September 28, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: October 16, 2023 at 14:00
* Procurement Category: Construction Services
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price

### Notice of Importance

This procurement project takes place on the traditional territories of the Halfway River First Nation, Blueberry River First Nation, Prophet River First Nation, Fort Nelson First Nation, and Lower Post First Nation. As part of the Government of Canada's commitment to reconciliation and meaningful engagement with Indigenous Peoples, bidders are required to demonstrate opportunities for Indigenous participation in the project.
